p: By then, the European Union had a set of rules to which member states were to abide in order to confirm, contain and eradicate any avian influence outbreak. The Avian Influence Directive and Decision 2006/135/EC 24 lays out explicit actions to be followed in the case of either a highly or a lowly pathogenic Asian influenza. The directive comes from the European Union, though the initial onus for response rests with the affected national state. The requirements for reporting mirror those of the IHRs: member states report to the EU, similarly as states report to the WHO.
